screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Languages & input" settings of an Android device. It displays the current language as "English (United States)" and lists available keyboards. The "Virtual keyboard" section includes options for Gboard and Google voice typing, while the "Physical keyboard" section shows connected keyboards like the AT Translated Set 2 and qwerty2. Additionally, there's an "Advanced" section for further keyboard and input settings.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.

think_action.Thought: The user wants to change the keyboard looks. Currently, the 'Languages & input' section is visible, and the available options include the virtual keyboard (Gboard) and Google voice typing. Since the user wants to change the keyboard appearance, the most relevant action would be to modify settings related to Gboard, which is the primary virtual keyboard listed. The next step will involve entering the Gboard settings to explore options for customizing the keyboard's appearance.
Future Action Plan: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard'.
Explore the options to change the look of the keyboard, such as themes, layouts, or styles.
Apply the desired changes to modify the keyboard appearance.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Click on the 'Gboard' option under 'Virtual keyboard'.
